clinical_study.brief_title: Sedline 4 Channel Electroencephalogram (EEG) Monitoring During Suppression of Unilateral Hemispheric Function (Wada Test
clinical_study.official_title: Sedline 4 Channel Electroencephalogram (EEG) Monitoring During Suppression of Unilateral Hemispheric Function (Wada Test)

brief_summary.textblock: Masimo Sedline brain function monitors are sensors (stickers) placed on a the forehead to monitor levels of "sedation" based on a bilateral 4-channel electroencephalogram (EEG). The purpose of this study is to observe the effectiveness of the Sedline monitor to detect the unilateral hemispheric EEG changes seen in Wada testing

clinical_study.why_stopped: There was to much artifact on the readings and could not be interpreted

primary_outcome.measure: Masimo Sedline brain function monitor- based on a bilateral 4-channel electroencephalogram (EEG). The purpose of this study is to observe the effectiveness of the Sedline monitor to detect the unilateral hemispheric EEG changes seen in Wada testing

intervention.description: Masimo Sedline brain function monitors are sensors (stickers) placed on a the forehead to monitor levels of "sedation" based on a bilateral 4-channel electroencephalogram (EEG). The purpose of this study is to observe the effectiveness of the Sedline monitor to detect the unilateral hemispheric EEG changes seen in Wada testing

study_pop.textblock: Participants will be 10 adult patients over 18 years old scheduled for Wada Testing at MUSC. One of the study team members will inform patients scheduled to undergo surgery about the opportunity to participate in the study prior to surgery. Patients will review and sign a written informed consent with a research study team member.
